column1: In 1947, India and Pakistan gained independence, leading to the first Indo-Pak war over Kashmir in 1947-1948.
In 1965, India and Pakistan fought a second war over Kashmir, resulting in a ceasefire agreement.
In 1971, the conflict between India and Pakistan led to the independence of Bangladesh, with India supporting East Pakistan.
In 1999, the Kargil War broke out between India and Pakistan, with India regaining control of the Kargil region.
In 2001, India and Pakistan were engaged in diplomatic talks aimed at easing tensions following the Kargil conflict.
